newsitem.title: UK: LCE white sugar make little change in late trade.
newsitem.headline: LCE white sugar make little change in late trade.

text.p: White sugar futures remained near opening levels in quiet later trading on Friday ahead of the three-day weekend in London and Hong Kong.
The most-active October contract closed up $0.70 at $352.40 while December ended flat at $345.90.
The day's low volume was largely confined to the two front months with October recording 341 lots and December 153 lots.

"I don't think anyone really wants to stick their neck out on the whites," said one, adding that a sudden move in New York while London was closed would immediately affect the whites market when it re-opens on Tuesday.
The LCE is closed on Monday due to a public holiday and re-opens on Tuesday, August 27.
Activity on the Paris market was unimpressive and price movements were slight. October was up 10 cents at $352.40 and December down 50 cents at $347.00.
